name: HD 213885
scenarioDescription:
The HD 213885 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 213885 is a star with 1.07 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.1 times its radius. It is located 156.45703319999998 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 213885 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 213885 system

HD 213885 b

HD 213885 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the Transit method. The mass of HD 213885 b is 8.83 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 213885 b is 1.745 that of Earth. At 8.83 Earth masses, HD 213885 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


HD 213885 c

HD 213885 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the Radial Velocity method.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 213885, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
